stimulusHtml: Of the following points, at which is the rate of change of  g  the least?

features.html:
• The figure is labeled "Graph of g". First and second quadrants are shown. No scale is indicated, but assuming that each grid line represents one unit, the x axis ranges from negative 5 to 4 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from 0 to 4 in increments of 1.
  • All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right:
    • The curve enters the window at (negative 5.2 comma 1.9).
    • The curve increases to reach a relative maximum at (negative 2.8 comma 4). This point is labeled A.
    • The curve decreases to pass through point B at (negative 1.7 comma 3.7).
    • The curve continues to decrease to point C at (negative 0.2 comma 2.8).
    • The curve continues to decrease but at a lesser and lesser rate to reach a relative minimum at (2.4 comma 1.5).
    • The curve increases to pass through (3 comma 1.6). This point is labeled D.
    • The curve continues to increase until it exits the window at (4.3 comma 2.8).

The figure shows the graph of a function g in the  x y -plane with four labeled points. It is known that a relative maximum of g occurs at A, and the only point of inflection of the graph of g is C.
